intro: Ternstroemia monosperma, commonly known as the single-seeded ternstroemia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Theaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters, and it produces a single, large seed per fruit. Ternstroemia monosperma is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks.
